page.title: 13Education in Sebergham
page.content: Primary education is provided in the neighbouring village of Welton and Secondary education in Dalston some seven miles away. Transport is by way of private buses. Adult education is also available in the afternoons or evenings at Dalston and Carlisle. Some families send their children to a privately owned and run school in Wigton, a former convent, or to the major and minor public schools. Farmers children are increasingly remaining at school until 17 or 18 rather than returning to work at home at the earliest opportunity. This is a changing and englightened attitude which comes about from the more scientific nature of farming today. Few farmers send their children on to agricultural college or university.
